chargeHist.descr: Wire Fraud Against a Financial Institution

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald R Fergerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: to Count 3.

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Count 3.

miscConds.notes: It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim E.A.M. (person, property, residence or family).  Repay surety $750.00 that was posted as bond.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including cognitive intervention and a psychological assessment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

Plea hearing on September 5, 2017 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Gerald R Fergerson in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Gerald R Fergerson in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense indicates they would like a COP in approx 30 days; the State indicates that the offer contemplates probation upon full payment of restitution. Defense motions the Court for signature bond as deft does not have the financial means to post cash. The State objects citing the deft's record, lack of ties to the community and because deft's case was out on warrant for 2 years.

BTC: Bond modification is denied  Plea hearing scheduled for September 5, 2017 at 08:45 am.
